{"step_by_step_thinking": "Daptacel and IPOL are two different vaccines used for different purposes. According to Document [0], Daptacel is a combined diphtheria and tetanus toxoids and acellular pertussis vaccine (DTaP) used for the first 4 doses of the diphtheria and tetanus toxoids and pertussis vaccination series administered to infants and children aged 6 weeks-6 years. On the other hand, Document [1] mentions that IPOL is a poliomyelitis vaccine. Therefore, Daptacel cannot be used instead of IPOL as they are used to prevent different diseases.", "answer_choice": "B"}
